page.title: 05Lambton Landmarks.
page.content: {Worm Hill On the North bank of the River Wear, next to Penshaw Bridge at Fatfield,is a small mound known as Worm Hill.It is said to be the hill around which the Lambton Worm "wrapped his tail ten times."There is now a war memorial on the top. {The River Wear The source of the Wear is at Wearhead in North Durham and its mouth at Sunderland.In Durham city its great meanders encircle the Norman Castle and Cathedral. {Penshaw Monument Although not in this survey area the monument can be seen from all parts.It was built by the tenants of a previous Lord Lambton who wanted to honour a generous landlord.However,the Lord, thinking they must be rich,raised the rent.The building remains incomplete.
